Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good service, average area”
Reviews.Author: Database M
Reviews.Content: The sum of individual elements make this hotel a good one. Design hotel and rooms are also nicely designed and functional in use. Great element is the free mini bar. Even though only non alcoholic, it provides a feel good moment to grab your drink. Rooms are noisy but I am afraid that European hotels are just not built with proper isolation. Fitness club is on the fourth floor. Not big but enough equipment and also here free bottles of water and towels. The staff is friendly, Christina at the breakfast was very nice. Recommendtion is that the staff can be a little bit more extrovert and pro-active. Food is not great but there are enough restaurants in the area. Area by the way is quiet, no much to do an lots of offices.

Reviews.Title: “My second home ... and a nice one”
Reviews.Author: lcorre
Reviews.Content: If you go to Madrid like me for business reasons, you'll like this hotel. Excellent rooms and free gym and minibar makes your stay a better one. I came here very often and staff is very friendly and always welcome you with a smile.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish and tasty”
Reviews.Author: Charles074
Reviews.Content: Well located near UPM, with easy access to the metro, and a very good breakfast. Pity not all staff speaks English and that Internet comes at an extra price..

Reviews.Title: “Great value, comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: Mike_in_Oxford_UK
Reviews.Content: As others have said, this is really great value - for the price you pay, you get a large room, comfortable bed, free non-alcoholic minibar and continental breakfast. As a place to stay when coming to Madrid on business, or for those who are happy to use public transport to get around, it can't be beaten. There are a couple of downsides for the business traveller that you need to consider. Firstly, I was told that there was no iron anywhere in the hotel (except for the laundry service), which was a little inconvenient. Secondly, the wired internet (didn't try wireless) was OK for web surfing but the virtual private network wouldn't function. However, overall a great stay and great value.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: CGC81
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, I always book it when I go to Madrid. Free non alcohol minibat, very modern, fantastic breakfast and no very crowded. Mainly for business people or couple.

Reviews.Title: “Away from happening spots, but very elegant”
Reviews.Author: majmani
Reviews.Content: The hotel is pretty close to the metro station. We could not get the directions at first (google maps aren't that accurate), but this hotel is pretty easy to find. Come out of the Guzman El Bueno station (towards Los Vascos) and look for the closest traffic signal. At the cross roads, you can find a Jamon corner and flower shop. Take the right turn into the street, and walk for approx 300meters. Hotel will be at your left hand side. Now, the hotel did not look very impressive at the first look. However, the check in was done in less than 5minutes, and the room key was handed immediately. Very effective indeed. Internet is free in the lobby, and in the room (i could browse thro my laptop but not iphone). Room was clean, bathroom was neat and clean. Free minibar, and very comfortable room. Breakfast is basic but then sufficient. There is just one lady working there, and she was friendly. I would recommend sitting outside for breakfast. It was very peaceful there. One point though, the exit of Los Vascos street at Guzman El Bueno station closes at 940pm. Which means, you have to come out of another exit and find you way to the hotel (which is hardly another 300 meter walk). It was a bit tough on us coz we arrived at almost 1am from plaza Sol (which was still active at that time), and the street near Los Vascos was literally empty with very few people around. A gentleman was kind enough to help us find the way to Los Vascos street, even though he was totally drunk. The sorrounding area shuts down by 10pm, which makes one feel unsafe. But all in all, we loved staying at this hotel and would definitely recommend staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Its too cheap for being so good! A 5 stars with a price of a 1 star”
Reviews.Author: frm87
Reviews.Content: Perfect, Boutique, elegant. I didnt expect that the hotel was so elegant and cheap. Free Internet, Freed sodas, free cofee. Perfect location. Very close to the subway station.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable, clean”
Reviews.Author: janegeorgia
Reviews.Content: loved the minibar that was gratis. Would hav preferred more consistent complementary breakfast. Sometimes there was coffee and patries, sometimes not.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, near metro station, quiet location.”
Reviews.Author: LJBLondon
Reviews.Content: This hotel was excellent, free minibar in the room! Quiet location - not central but only 2 minutes from a metro station so easy access to the centre. Only 20 minutes from the airport as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Easy to Get to City Center”
Reviews.Author: Pablohow
Reviews.Content: Great value. Though the hotel appears to be a bit out of the way (it wasn't even on most maps), it is just a quick trip on the Metro or a cheap taxi ride to all Madrid has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “good choice for the citiy zone”
Reviews.Author: helcia
Reviews.Content: Excellent stay, if you have to do business or see people in this aerea of Madrid. For tourism it is too far away from main the atractions and upper grade shopping. Restaurants close by are nothing special. The hotel is very modern, reception very friendly and helpfull (although if you need a taxi at rush-our time you have to get it yourself at the mainstreet 300m away). Breakfast is ok. Everthing is super clean. Free afternoon snacks (coffee, tea, rolls, but also whiskey etc) in the lobby.

HotelInfo.Name: AC Hotel Los Vascos by Marriott
HotelInfo.Address: C/ Los Vascos 27, 28040 Madrid, Spain
